title: Appeals court reverses Texas ruling nullifying FDA approval of abortion pill
description: The ruling does not affect access to mifepristone; SCOTUS will decide the case.

title: DirectX 12 support comes to CrossOver on Mac with latest update
description: CrossOver for Linux got some updates too—but not DirectX 12.

title: An Iowa school district is using ChatGPT to decide which books to ban
description: Official: "It is simply not feasible to read every book" for depictions of sex.

title: FDA finally nabs alleged quack who claimed silver vibrations cure COVID
description: Gordon H. Pedersen of Utah was on the run from fraud charges for three years.

title: Amazon pinches sellers: Use our costly logistics services or pay extra fee
description: Change comes as booksellers urge FTC to launch another Amazon antitrust inquiry.

title: Adobe and Microsoft break some old files by removing PostScript font support
description: PostScript Type 1 fonts are decades old, but apps supported them until recently.

title: Tech error let people with empty bank accounts withdraw hundreds in cash
description: Bank of Ireland says the problem wasn't connected to a cyberattack.

title: X apparently added 5-second delay for links to sites Musk doesn’t like
description: X, formerly Twitter, "confirmed the delay was removed but did not elaborate."

title: Windows feature that resets system clocks based on random data is wreaking havoc
description: Windows Secure Time Seeding resets clocks months or years off the correct time.

title: $220 billion is helping build US cleantech infrastructure. Here are the projects.
description: Financial Times identified 110 large-scale manufacturing announcements.

title: AI chatbot scares Snapchat users by posting mysterious video
description: "I swear I thought that was my wall."

title: China blocks Intel’s $5.4B merger with Tower Semiconductor
description: Deal ends with Intel paying a $353 million termination fee to Tower.

title: Public EV charging keeps getting worse, according to new study
description: Volta and Tesla Superchargers had the most satisfied customers, according to JD Power.

title: Early plate tectonics was surprisingly speedy
description: A chunk of Western Australia once raced across the globe at over 64 cm a year.

title: New Triassic fossil features sharp claws and a nasty beak
description: A non-flying precursor to pterosaurs shared the Earth with the first dinosaurs.

title: Xbox’s new “8 strikes” mod rollout judges hate speech 3x worse than cheating
description: Eight strikes = one-year suspension; "egregious" infractions can cause permanent bans.
